column4: right, basically i installed ubuntu about 2 hours ago, expert installation cos i didnt wanna lose windows. for some reason it wont pick up my mouse and i have to use my trackpad (how do i fix that) and also, when i try to open a number of different apps, like add new apps and networking, nothing happens. i need networking to setup my wifi card
that, i think, is a consequence of you chosing the "expert" mode. the "expert" mode creates a root password, which interferes with the working of control panel applets
by the way, as far as i know, "normal" install is definitely not going to destroy your windows.
that site should explain you how to remove the root password
